CatDescriptText: A group of women dressed in military clothing stand under sign, which reads 'Back The Attack-Buy Bonds.'  During World War II (1939-1945) efforts were supported by these women who took the forefront on campaigning to other African Americans to buy bonds from the government to support the world effort waged by the United States.
TitMainTitle: Women, possibly including Ruth Gwynnon on far right, posed behind booth with sign reading "Back the Attack - Buy Bonds," and van from Ann Street Radio, Homestead
